availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Oliver H. Dewey (Fleming County shoemaker and Justice of the Peace)

body.p: Fleming County shoemaker and Justice of the Peace. Connecticut native. Married Mary Dewey. Elizaville Postmaster from 1841 to 1843. Fleming County Justice of the Peace in c1864.

bibl.p: KYR-0001-004-1305. KYR-0001-004-1306. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, District 1, p. 46. Lutie Allen Vansant Crutcher, “History of Elizaville,” Fleming Gazette (Ky.), February 7, 1952. Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, Ancestry, vol. 12, p. 304.
